CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 11 - Freedom of assembly and association
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a presidential election was held in GPE with its first and second rounds taking place on DATE and DATE respectively . The applicant acted as an authorised election assistant ( վստահված անձ ) for the main opposition candidate in this election . Following the first and second rounds of the election , a series of protest rallies were organised in GPE by the opposition parties .
CARDINAL . According to the materials of the case , the applicant attended CARDINAL of these rallies on DATE . The applicant denied this fact and alleged that he had not attended the rallies .

CARDINAL . On DATE at TIME the applicant was visited at home by QUANTITY police officers from LOC ՀՀ ոստիկանության ORG բաժին ) . He was informed that the chief of the police department wished to speak to him and was taken to the police station .

CARDINAL . At the police station an administrative case was initiated against the applicant who was charged under LAW ( Վարչական իրավախախտումների վերաբերյալ ՀՀ օրենսգիրք – “ the CAO ” ) with minor hooliganism on the ground that he had participated in the unauthorised demonstration of DATE and had violated public order .

CARDINAL . On DATE , TIME , the applicant was taken to the GPE and ORG of GPE ( Երևան քաղաքի Կենտրոն և Նորք-Մարաշ համայնքների առաջին ատյանի դատարան ) . There he was brought before Judge PERSON who , after a brief hearing , found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced him to DATE of administrative detention , finding that :
“ On DATE on FAC in GPE [ the applicant ] participated together with a group of people in an unauthorised demonstration and march , and violated public order . ”
CARDINAL . The decision stated that it could be protested against by the prosecutor under LAW ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicant was taken to a detention facility to serve his sentence .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant alleged that on DATE he was taken from his cell to another room . On the table in this room there were CARDINAL sample applications , CARDINAL of which was handed to him with the instruction to write and sign his name on it . The content of the application was a statement which declared : “ I regret what I have done and request a review of my case . ” This request was addressed to the President of the Criminal and Military Court of Appeal ( ՀՀ քրեական և զինվորական գործերով վերաքննիչ դատարանի նախագահ ) . The applicant alleged that he had to sign this document , even though he disagreed with its contents , in order to be released and to be able to perform his authorised election assistant duties in the second round of the presidential election .
CARDINAL . On DATE the President of the Criminal and Military Court of Appeal reviewed the applicant ’s conviction , finding that :
“ [ The applicant , according to the decision of ORG , was subjected to administrative detention ] ... for attending an unauthorised demonstration in LOC of GPE on DATE and violating public order .
Having familiarised myself with [ the applicant ’s ] appeal and the materials concerning the administrative offence , I find that the penalty imposed on [ the applicant ] must be changed . ”
CARDINAL . NORP The President changed the penalty to an administrative fine of CARDINAL NORP drams ( ORG ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) at the material time ) and ordered the applicant ’s release .
CARDINAL . On TIME the applicant was released from detention after having served about three days of his sentence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent applications to ORG ( ՀՀ արդարադատության նախարարություն ) , ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) and ORG ( ՀՀ նախագահին առընթեր մարդու իրավունքների հարցերի հանձնաժողով ) , arguing that he had never participated in any demonstrations , and in particular the one held on DATE , and seeking a review of his case .
CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE ORG forwarded the applicant ’s application to be dealt with by the Criminal and Military Court of Appeal .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE ORG informed the applicant that the rights of persons charged with an administrative offence were defined in LAW ORG and should have been invoked by the applicant during the examination of his case . The letter further stated that the decision of CARDINAL DATE could be protested against by the prosecutor .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE the President of the Criminal and Military Court of Appeal informed the applicant that his application of DATE could not be examined , since the applicant had missed the prescribed DATE time - limit for appeal .
CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG gave a similar reply to the applicant ’s application addressed to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again complained to ORG that the decision of CARDINAL DATE had been unlawful since he had not participated in any demonstration .
CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG gave the same reply .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Դատական ակտերի հարկադիր կատարման ծառայություն – “ the DEJA ” ) instituted enforcement proceedings on the basis of an execution writ issued by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant alleged that , around that period , he was visited at home by an officer of the LOC who informed him that the decision of CARDINAL DATE had been reviewed on DATE and a fine had been imposed . He further alleged that only then did he become aware of the existence of the decision of the President of the Criminal and Military Court of Appeal of CARDINAL DATE . The applicant paid the fine .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided to terminate the enforcement proceedings since the terms of the execution writ had been complied with .
CARDINAL . For a summary of the relevant domestic provisions and international documents and reports see the judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . GPE , § § DATE , DATE ) .
